info.name: Bilit.com V1.0
info.description:
## Bilit.com RESTful API Web Services
---

Bilit RESTful API provides a range of web services to communicate with server resources also having access to available products, services and functionalities through API endpoints.

### Security Layer
- All transactions transfer through **HTTPS** protocol secured with **SSL** certificate
- API access authenticates with **OAuth2** protocol, so access token is required to communicate with server
- Dynamic token authentication with limited lifetime

### General
- API base URL address is: {{base_url}}/api
- Base URL follows with major version of API like {{base_url}}/api/v1 *(v1: Major version)*
- API is accessible only with HTTP**S** protocol
- API versioning follows [Semantic Versioning 2.0.0](https://semver.org/)
- Authentication with Bearer Token

### Content Negotiation
- Request and response body are JSON format only
- Preferred content language standard is ISO 639-1 *(format: en-US)*
- Content type versioning with minor version *(v1.x where x is minor version - v1.0)*
- Content type encoding *charset=UTF-8*

[Download](#db30ab3b-f454-48a1-8074-00e809b0541e) ready to use Postman collection

#### Response Format
All responses body will return in JSON format.

Sample response for successful request:

    {
        "access_token": "cee2ea785264d78bf4...bKTkQMMcYmsf220191222231551"
    }

Sample response for unsuccessful request:

    {
        "name": "Unauthorized",
        "message": "Your request was made with invalid credentials.",
        "code": 0,
        "status": 401
    }

##### Custome Response Formatting (optional)
There are some query param options which letting customize response formatting.

***wrap_response_data:*** by setting this option value to **`1`**, response body data will wrap into `data` field and a `success` status field will add to response.

Sample request for wrapping data:

    GET {{base_url}}/v1/user?wrap_response_data=1

Sample response for wrapped data:

    {
        "success": true,
        "data": {
            "cellphone": "09999999999",
            "email": "email@mailer.com",
            "fullname": null,
            "dob": null,
            "gender": null,
            "credit": 0
        }
    }



***suppress_response_code:*** instead of relying on using different HTTP statuses to indicate different errors, it always uses `200` as HTTP status and encloses the actual HTTP status code as part of the JSON structure in the response.

Sample request for suppress response code:

    GET {{base_url}}/v1/user?wrap_response_data=1&suppress_response_code=1
Sample response header for suppress response code:

    HTTP/1.1 200 OK
    Server: nginx
    Date: Thu, 02 Jan 2020 09:34:08 GMT
    Content-Type: application/json; charset=UTF-8
    ...
Sample response body for suppress response code:

    {
        "success": true,
        "data": {
            "name": "Unauthorized",
            "message": "Your request was made with invalid credentials.",
            "code": 0,
            "status": 401
        }
    }
**Note:** please note when suppress response option is true, response header status code always is `200` and `success` field in response body always is `true`.

item.name: Authentication

request.description:
When the old token is not available to refresh that or password changed, sign-in with user account credentials is required to receive a new token.

To sign-in username (cellphone number) and password are required and must send with request body as JSON data. If user credentials was valid an access token will return in response body.

***Note:*** Sing-in doesn't need to send old token. Only sending credentials in body is enough.
##### Required Fields to Sign-in

|Field|Type|Null|Validation|Description|
|--|--|--|--|--|
|username|char(11)|NO|cellphone pattern|a unique cellphone number which uses as account username to sign-in|
|password|string|NO|min: 8char - alphanumeric with min 1 capital letter|account password to sign-in|

response.name: user/auth (sign-in - fail)

request.description:
With dynamic token authentication each token will expire after a period of time (lifetime) and new token will be needed to access API again. When token expired a **`401`** error returns.

Currently token lifetime is **1200** seconds. To refresh token, old access token must send in header.

response.name: user/auth (refresh - fail)

item.description:
To access and communicate with web services, authentication procedure is required, because with each request needs an access token sent in header *Authorization*.

There are two authentication process to receive a new token. First method is re-authenticate to refresh access token. This method must use when last access token is available. Second method is authenticate with user credentials to get a new access token and must use when last token is not available or changed.

***Note:*** sending access token with all requests except sing-in and recover password is required.

##### Access Token
|Name|Type|Null|Description|
|--|--|--|--|
|access_token|string|NO|min: 64, max: 255|

item.name: User

request.description:
Before have access to API and working with web services a user account is needed. Anyone can sign-up and create new account with providing minimum need information in bilit.com.
In response to successful sing-up an access token will be returned otherwise validation error or any exception with related header error returns.
##### Required Fields to Sign-up
|Field|Type|Null|Validation|Description|
|--|--|--|--|--|
|username|char(11)|NO|cellphone pattern|a unique cellphone number which uses as account username to sign-in|
|email|varchar(255)|NO|email pattern|a unique email address|
|password|string|NO|min: 8char - alphanumeric with min 1 capital letter|account password to sign-in|

response.name: user (sing-up - fail)

request.description:
This endpoint uses to retrieve user information like cellphone number, email address, date of birth, wallet credit and etc.

##### Returned Data 
|Field|Type|Null|Description|
|--|--|--|--|
|cellphone|string|NO|same as account username|
|email|string|NO||
|fullname|string|YES|user full name|
|dob|string|YES|user's Jalali date of birth, format: YYYY-MM-DD|
|gender|integer|YES|gender ID|
|credit|integer / decimal|YES|available as expand field|

response.name: user (info - fail)
user (info - suppress response code)
user (info - wrap data)

request.description:
It is possible to update and change user information with API. To update a user info, fields to update must send in request body as JSON data.

For successful request user information with updated fields returns.

|Field|Type|Null|Validation|Description|
|--|--|--|--|--|
|cellphone|string|YES|cellphone pattern|same as account username|
|email|string|YES|email pattern||
|fullname|string|YES|varchar(96)|user full name|
|dob|string|YES|date|user's Jalali date of birth, format: YYYY-MM-DD|
|gender|integer|YES|integer|gender ID|

***Note:*** it's not possible to update user's wallet credit through user update endpoint. Please refer to wallet endpoints.

response.name: user (update - fail)

request.description:
Any user can changes its account password through API `user/passwd` endpoint.
The current password and new one must send as JSON data in request body.

A respone header with **`204`** status code with no body will return.

##### Required Fields
|Field|Type|Null|Validation|
|--|--|--|--|
|current_password|string|NO|min: 8char - alphanumeric with min 1 capital letter|
|new_password|string|NO|min: 8char - alphanumeric with min 1 capital letter|

By this endpoint users that forgot their password, can request for a recovery password. A new auto generated password will sent to specified cellphone with SMS if there is an account related to that cellphone number.

A respone header with **`204`** status code with no body will return.

|Field|Type|Null|Validation|Description|
|--|--|--|--|--|
|cellphone|char(11)|NO|cellphone pattern|cellphone number related to account|

item.description: User management endpoints let to create new user, get user information, update user info and change sign-in password.

item.name: References
item.description:
#### API Version
This document is related to API V1.0.

|version|major|minor|debug|
|--|--|--|--|
|v1.x.x|v1|v1.x|v1.x.x|

[Semantic Versioning 2.0.0](https://semver.org/)

#### Base URL
API base URL for access to endpoints.

|Environment|Address|
|--|--|
|Development|https://bilit.cooode.run/api|
|Production|https://bilit.com/api|

***Note:*** only use **HTTPS** protocol.


### Supported Languages
Currently in this version of API only two languages are supported. (In next versions list of available languages will be accessible via an endpoint).

Current available languages:

|Language|Code|
|--|--|
|Persian|fa-IR|
|English|en-US|

### Reference IDs
List of ID for some resources. *(In next versions id of resources will be accessible via endpoints)*
##### Gender
|ID|Value|
|--|--|
|0|Female|
|1|Male|

### General HTTP Errors List
For handled errors or exceptions, status code will be returned in response header and error details in response body.

Response Error Header Format *(Sample)*:

    HTTP/1.1 401 Unauthorized
    Date: Sun, 22 Dec 2019 19:34:40 GMT
    Content-Type: application/json; charset=UTF-8
    ...

Response Error Body Format *(Sample)*:

    {
        "name": "Unauthorized",
        "message": "Your request was made with invalid credentials.",
        "code": 0,
        "status": 401
    }

The following list summarizes the HTTP status codes:

-   `200`: OK. Everything worked as expected.
-   `201`: A resource was successfully created in response to a `POST` request. The `Location` header can contains the URL pointing to the newly created resource.
-   `204`: The request was handled successfully and the response contains no body content (like a `DELETE` request).
-   `304`: The resource was not modified. You can use the cached version.
-   `400`: Bad request. This could be caused by various actions by the user, such as providing invalid JSON data in the request body, providing invalid action parameters, etc.
-   `401`: Authentication failed.
-   `403`: The authenticated user is not allowed to access the specified API endpoint.
-   `404`: The requested resource does not exist.
-   `405`: Method not allowed. Please check the `Allow` header for the allowed HTTP methods.
-   `415`: Unsupported media type. The requested content type or version number is invalid.
-   `422`: Data validation failed (in response to a `POST` request, for example). Please check the response body for detailed error messages.
-   `429`: Too many requests. The request was rejected due to rate limiting.
-   `500`: Internal server error. This could be caused by internal program errors.
